job_title: Vice President Operations in Harrison, AR
cons: Not many cons. They do a good job.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Harrison, NJ
pros: Benefits of prescription program within their facility
cons: The" lead social worker" micromanages everything with poor boundaries despite she was peer.

job_title: MLT ASCP CM in Harrison, AR
pros: Most of the employees are really nice, especially the custodians.
cons: You never know what shift you're going to work. They will make you work 1400-2230, and then come back at 1800-0600, then back to 1400 again. The HR department will laugh at you when you ask for a raise even when you bring them surrounding hospital wages. They pay the lab so poorly you will qualify for food stamps. They keep the entire facility severely understaffed.

review_title: Not the worst, not the best
job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Harrison, AR
pros: Great people work at this facility.
cons: Poor management in some departments. Less than average pay

job_title: Emergency Room Tech in Harrison, AR
pros: Gained experience, had some great team members, impacted peoples lives in a positive way. Some people really put their best into their job.
cons: A lot of experienced staff members and management are either leaving or wrongfully fired. There is always talk of corruption and possible fraud.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Harrison, AR
pros: really enjoy the staff, everyone is nice
cons: lots of travelers, does not pay full time staff competitively

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Harrison, AR
pros: There are a lot of employment opportunities.
cons: Does not pay adequately for work expected, lies to patients and employees.

review_title: Not a very good place to work
pros: They pay you to come to work, that's about it.
cons: Things used to be great.  Then we have gone through several CEO's.  The current CEO doesn't care about anyone but doctors, everyone else is replaceable.  I've seen career people terminated without notice for no apparent reason.  He also likes to surround himself with young attractive women.  We just got our first raise in 3 years. CEO is out of touch with with employees.  You see him once or twice a year, mainly to deliver news to you that your benefits are being cut and that you are going to be forced to take your vacation days when you don't want to.

pros: Insurance premiums aren't bad for a self insured group, decent coverage too. Access to physicians, employed and non-employed, which helps if you need a doctor unexpectedly.
cons: If you're not in the 'clique' of certain Management, you're targeted for not agreeing with them. It's unfortunate, there are a lot of good & talented employees that aren't encouraged to voice their ideas.

review_title: Company that wants you to give your all and they will give nothing.
job_title: Clinical Medical Assistant in Harrison, AR
pros:
Excellent Health Insurance with no deductibles to NARMC CLINICS
On the Job Training provided if it
Is needed 
Close to Home - if you live in this area you won’t have a long commute
cons:
Long work hours and never will you get the breaks that you should be given 
If you don’t sleep your way to the top you will stay where you are  
No chance at advancing

review_title: Great teamwork but no room for growth
pros: Great entry level opportunities in a rural area. Great people to work with.
cons: Poor PA of administration. No room for growth. Employees don't get paid what they deserve to.

pros: Team members work hard and do their best to serve patients and the community.
cons: Toxic culture starts at the top and rolls down. Pay is mediocre and raises never seem to happen - even when more work is added to your plate. Awards and recognition is non-existent. Most employees are not empowered or trusted to do their jobs; instead they are treated like children.

review_title: Administration needs to work the Studer Principal
pros: Small town hospital but to far from a major city if you need a specialist
cons: It is who you know. Not the work you perform

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician I (MLT) in Harrison, AR
pros: Pleasant place to work. Managers let you do your job.
cons: Very shorthanded mostly because of the pay in the area but is affordable.
